page.title: 03The Community of Salem
page.content: The estimated population of the 3x4km area surveyed is 291. In spite of the differences mentioned on page 1, the village is a friendly, well integrated community, with no class barriers. However, on the whole the older Welsh - speaking inhabitants tend to resent the great influx of non Welsh speakers with more sophisticated lifestyles, because they see their traditional way of life being eroded. At present the balance of Welsh and English speakers ( as first language ) is about equal. There are still some farms that have an extremely basic lifestyle. There are only whites of British descent;no other ethnic groups at all. The majority of the commuter 'incomers' have chosen to live here because of its rural situation, and as yet unpoiled charm, and are content with the village as it exists today.
